alert.note: Alert for Parker Valley (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued November 24 at 12:29AM MST until November 24 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST /6 PM PST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...North winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...In Arizona, Parker Valley. In California, Western portion of Joshua Tree National Park, Chuckwalla Mountains, Southeastern Imperial County, Chiriaco Summit, Palo Verde Valley and Chuckwalla Valley. * WHEN...Until 7 PM MST /6 PM PST/ this evening. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
